translation.home-detail: Tymt is a multi-chain game launcher and an environment fo creating and publishing games
translation.featured-detail: Tymt GAMES is a gaming environment and platform, built using the Solar Core blockchain solutions, enabling a new world of game economy - empowering Developers and Publishers!
translation.district-detail: 'District 53: Voxel Metropolis' is an immersive voxel-based strategy game set in a retro-futuristic cityscape, where players vie for dominance over an ever-evolving urban jungle of neon and steel. In 'District 53: Voxel Metropolis', you ...
translation.wallet-detail-1: In order to enjoy all the benefits of Web3 gaming - you need a “blockchain id” - an “address” - just like you do when you install a
translation.wallet-detail-2: When you Sign-in to tymt - it will automatically create 5 such “addresses”: on Solar (SXP), ERC-20 (ETH), BSC (BNB), Solana (SOL), Polygon (MATIC), and Bitcoin chains. You can easily access and manage them from your Wallet in order to Pay with any currency - and Play on any chain.
translation.step-1-detail: Download and install the tymt launcher.
translation.step-2-detail: Create your account. If you have a Solar Wallet, or a Solar Card App - you can import your account as well!
translation.step-3-detail: Make sure to secure and store your pass-phrase. Remember that in Web3 - your phrase is the ultimate key to restore your wallet.
translation.step-4-detail: Visit the Catalog for a list of available games. Currently tymt features District 53 - a voxel-based metaverse developed by tymt GAMES / Dokdo.
translation.step-5-detail: Join our social channels for community support, help and to meet new friends!
translation.publisher-detail: Our mission is to bridge, connect and empower Gamers, Developers and Game Publishers - we think in terms of Community, rather than Competition. If you want to reach a new community of potential gamers - publish your game on tymt!
translation.publisher-contact: Simply contact us and publsih your game
translation.developer-contact: Visit our GitHub repository for all documentation and SDK
